Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday February 23), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, february 23rd. meta platforms faces growing antitrust scrutiny as the federal trade commission ramps up its investigation into potential monopolistic practices related to its social networking services. the inquiry focuses on how meta consolidates data from its various platforms and any potential impacts on competition. as lawmakers continue to zero in on tech giants, meta says it is cooperating fully with the investigation.

meanwhile, google has announced a significant expansion of its cloud infrastructure in africa, opening its first ai research center on the continent in ghana. ceo sundar pichai emphasized the importance of fostering ai talent and innovation in emerging markets, saying that local ai solutions can have a global impact. this move is part of google's broader strategy to tap into new markets and cultivate local expertise.

in more regional news, samsung is experiencing supply chain hurdles, which have led to production delays for its latest line of smartphones. the company cites a shortage of critical components as the main reason for the slowdowns but reassures consumers that it is working diligently to resolve the issues. samsung remains optimistic about meeting its annual production targets despite these challenges.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, february 23rd.

meta platforms is under increasing antitrust scrutiny as the federal trade commission intensifies its investigation into alleged monopolistic practices involving its social networking services. the focus of the inquiry is on meta's data consolidation across its various platforms and its potential impact on market competition. as lawmakers continue to concentrate on tech giants, meta has stated that it is fully cooperating with the investigation.

turning to africa, google has announced a major expansion of its cloud infrastructure with the launch of its first ai research center on the continent, located in ghana. ceo sundar pichai highlighted the significance of nurturing ai talent and innovation in emerging markets, noting that local ai solutions can have a far-reaching global impact. this initiative is part of google's broader strategy to explore new markets and build local expertise.

in regional news, samsung is grappling with supply chain challenges resulting in production delays for its new smartphone lineup. the company attributes these delays to a shortage of critical components but assures consumers that it is working diligently to address the issue. despite the hurdles, samsung remains confident in meeting its annual production goals.

that's all from us today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-481 Ftc Vs. Meta's Monopoly Scrutiny 🏢, Google's Ai Leap in Ghana 🌍, Samsung's Supply Chain Struggle 📱
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, february 23rd. here's what's happening in the tech world:

  • meta under scrutiny: meta platforms faces intensified antitrust investigations by the federal trade commission, focusing on data consolidation and potential anticompetitive practices.
  • google's ai expansion in africa: google launches its first ai research center in ghana, emphasizing the importance of developing local ai talent in emerging markets for global impact.
  • samsung's supply chain issues: production delays in samsung’s new smartphone lineup due to component shortages, with assurances of efforts to resolve the situation and meet production goals.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow!
Image Prompt: the podcast cover image features a dynamic perspective of a bustling cityscape at twilight, symbolizing technological innovation. in the foreground, a towering, stylized skyscraper embodies meta, its structure subtly suggesting the shape of an 'm'. radiating around the building is a complex network of holographic data streams, representing scrutiny and oversight, swirling in the background. to the right, a vibrant and lush scene of ghana comes to life with elements of traditional culture intertwined with futuristic digital elements, illustrating google's ai revolution. overlaying this scene are interconnected nodes that symbolize ai's expansive growth. dominating the lower left corner, a semi-transparent smartphone with faint circuitry visible inside signifies samsung's supply chain challenges, with fragmented pieces around it subtly suggesting disruption. the blending of urbanity, tradition, technology, and connectivity culminates in a unified image that visually narrates the intersection of global tech and industry dynamics
